column4: I need to find the point my Drive mounts on so i can unhide the files.
Dont ask me the page is telling me to do this
sudo mount -t udf -o ro,unhide /dev/cdrom /media/cdrom0/  is my command, but im not sure why its not finding it
http://www.ehow.com/how_4717958_install-king-dvd-ultimate-linux.html
its an older one, but its all the same as the new ones in cmd's
I'v been trying everything for hours to install this stupid thing.
nothing
it say's not found
i'v tried all possible drive names
that i know of
when you ls /media/cdrom0 -- it exists?
what cd are you mounting?
that would do it :) sudo mkdir /media/cdrom0 and then try again
ls again and see if your stuff is there?
hmm .. please check in /etc/mtab to see if you find a line for /media/cdrom0
if not, I'm not really sur what happened .. do you have a cd we know what format it is in? like an old music cd or an ubuntu live cd ?
what is in the drive now?
that runs on linux?
well, the dev is wrong .. udf is for dvds -- I don't know if it matters
try this: sudo mount /dev/dvd /media/cdrom0
or if that fails add the -t udf in there
cd you ls it and see your stuff?
congradulations :) you've suceeded
I can't help you with the software .. just the os
